collection.question_en: How much risk is there in your industry or profession?
collection.question_fr: How much risk is there in your industry or profession?(FR)
collection.context_en: In some industries or professions there is a greater chance somebody will take legal action against you or your company. They may seek compensation for personal injury, property damage, or financial loss for example. Some industries like construction, transportation, fishing, and manufacturing - and some professions like medicine and dentistry - have high risks than others. If you think your industry may have high risk you will probably want to protect yourself through a limited liability structure. (e.g., corporation or limited liability partnership.)

collection.question_en: How do you feel about personal risk?
collection.question_fr: How do you feel about personal risk?(FR)
collection.context_en: Personal risk in a business is the chance that legal action might be taken against you personally, and that you might suffer personal financial losses. If you are concerened about personal risk, or have a lot of personal assets, a corporation or limited liability partnership may make the most sense.

collection.question_en: How many owners will you have?
collection.question_fr: How many owners will you have?(FR)
collection.context_en: The number determines your organization type options. Sole proprietorships have only one owner, and partnerships must have at elast 2 owners, while a corporation can have any number of owners.
collection.context_fr: The number determines your organization type options. Sole proprietorships have only one owner, and partnerships must have at elast 2 owners, while a corporation can have any number of owners.(FR)

collection.context_en: These costs include legal fees, accounting fees, tax return preparation, bookkeeping, and provincial and federal filling fees. Propietorships and general partnerships have the lowest setup and ongoing costs. Other entity types are more costly to set up, and more costly to maintain.

collection.question_en: How important is protecting your organization's name?
collection.question_fr: How important is protecting your organization's name?(FR)
collection.context_en: Incorporation provides a higher level of name protection than other entity types. If you are a sole proprietorship -or parnership -and someone inforporates using your business name, they will get the name. Sol proprietorships and partnerships have no name protection in this area.
